result.execSummary:
The defendant Morris D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed. 

No contact with L.T.D. unless authorized by agent.

Sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program. 

AODA and follow through with recommendations. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Nicole.
Case called: 1:24 p.m.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall and Probation Agent; Defendant appears in person, pro se.
(Probation Review Hearing)

COURT questions defendant if he/she has received a copy of the probation review.
COURT reviews progress with Deft. 

COURT declines to set another PRH.
DATES:
PRH: 12/16/22 @ 1:15 p.m. Branch 3.


Adj: 1:25 p.m.
Probation Status Report
Probation review hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:44 am 
INCLUDES 22CF125 AND 22CF600. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person with Atty Adam Fontana.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 22CF125: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF600: Cts. 1 - 3>>D&RI. 
Uncharged DA's Case 22MA2610>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 22CF125: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA Repeater/Repeater/ DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with LTD unless authorized by agent; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) and 1 DA surcharge; 90 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 
Probation Review Hrg set for 10/21/2022 at 1:15 pm.
